result.execSummary:
The defendant Landon G Weatherspoon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Solicitation of Prostitutes, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 944.32.
  • Solicitation of Prostitutes, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 944.32.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: count 4 in 13cf1161 but concurrent with count 3 in 13cf1161

superMiscConds.notes: Statutory court costs assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
It is a condition of extended supervision that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.

No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).
Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. 
Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
No use of computer or internet without the agent's approval.
No use of a smart phone.
DNA sample if not provided already.
No posting of profile on any website.
No photographing of child under 18 years without agent's approval.
Sign release with agent before filling any prescriptions.  
Firearm warning given.  
Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

supervisions.notes: **AMENDED 6-16-2015:  Length of Extended Supervision is reduced to 3 years.**

Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: count 4 in 13cf1161 but concurrent with count 3 in 13cf1161 & count 1 in 14cf382

superMiscConds.notes: Statutory court costs assessed.    If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes:
**AMENDED 6-16-2015:  Length of Extended Supervision is reduced to 3 years.**
Balance of conditions are the same as in count 1.

Defendant Landon G Weatherspoon in court with attorney Mark D. Richards and Brian Dimmer.  Defendant Landon G Weatherspoon in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.

Parties state that 13CF1160, who is a co-defendant, had a sentencing heard in front of Judge Boyle.  Atty Richards will obtain transcript of that hearing.
Attorney Richards raises issues of witnesses.
BTC:  Atty Richards is to bring specific motions.

Motion to Suppress.

State marks Ex 2.
Atty Richards moves Ex 1&2 into evidence.  State has no obj.  BTC:  Ex 1&2 rec'd.

Parties request to submit briefs.
BTC:  Simultaneous briefs are to be filed by 2/27/15.  All other motions are to be filed by 2/27/15.

Defendant Landon G Weatherspoon in court with attorney Robert W Peterson.  Brian Dimmer appears for Atty. Mark Richards. Defendant Landon G Weatherspoon in custody.  Noah Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
Mr. Peterson appears specially and indicates that defendant has retained Atty Mark Richards. Mr. Peterson has delivered the file to Mr. Richards. Atty. Dimmer indicates that it would be prudent to cancel the jury trial and there might be a Miranda/Goodchild issue. Defense asks for a status  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Landon G Weatherspoon in court with attorney Robert William Peterson.  Defendant Landon G Weatherspoon in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
Defense asks for deft's bond to be modified to between $6000-$8000 cash and deft will reside at 8512 Gittings Rd, Mt Pleasant with his parents. The State notes the serious nature of the charges, indicates that there are additional charges that can be issued,  and feel the bonds are appropriate as set.

Defense indicates they are still waiting for some discovery but this case is still postured for trial and the 2014 case will track
